intro: Rhexia deppeana, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to lavender flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy roots that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Rhexia deppeana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
